main_screen_tip: " Positive thinking will let you do everything better than negative thinking will. " - Zig Ziglar

poem.title: To Mr. Murray
poem.author: George Gordon, Lord Byron
lines: Strahan, Tonson, Lintot of the times,
Patron and publisher of rhymes,
For thee the bard up Pindus climbs,
My Murray.
To thee, with hope and terror dumb,
The unfledged MS. authors come;
Thou printest all--and sellest some--
My Murray.
Upon thy table's baize so green
The last new Quarterly is seen,--
But where is thy new Magazine,
My Murray?
Along thy sprucest bookshelves shine
The works thou deemest most divine--
The Art of Cookery, and mine,
My Murray.
Tours, Travels, Essays, too, I wist,
And Sermons, to thy mill bring grist;
And then thou hast the _Navy List_,
My Murray.
And Heaven forbid I should conclude,
Without "the Board of Longitude,"
Although this narrow paper would,
My Murray.
